def length(lst):
Return the number of elements in lst.
def is_empty(lst):
Return True if lst has no elements, else False.
def head(lst):
Return the first element of lst, or raise if empty.
def tail(lst):
Return a new list of all elements except the first.
def last(lst):
Return the last element of lst, or raise if empty.
def init(lst):
Return a new list of all elements except the last.
def reverse(lst):
Return a new list with elements of lst in reverse order.
def copy(lst):
Return a shallow copy of lst.
def append_item(lst, value):
Return a new list with value appended to the end.
def prepend_item(lst, value):
Return a new list with value inserted at the beginning.
def insert_at(lst, index, value):
Return a new list with value inserted at position index.
def remove_at(lst, index):
Return a new list with the element at index removed.
def replace_at(lst, index, value):
Return a new list with the element at index replaced by value.
def slice_range(lst, start, end):
Return a sublist from start (inclusive) to end (exclusive).
def concat(lst, other):
Return a new list that is lst followed by other.
def index_of(lst, value):
Return the first index of value in lst, or -1 if not found.
def last_index_of(lst, value):
Return the last index of value in lst, or -1 if not found.
def contains(lst, value):
Return True if value appears in lst, else False.
def count_value(lst, value):
Return how many times value appears in lst.
def all_equal(lst):
Return True if all elements in lst are equal or lst is empty.
def equals(lst, other):
Return True if lst and other have the same elements in the same order.
def unique(lst):
Return a new list with first occurrences of each value, preserving order.
def dedupe_consecutive(lst):
Return a new list with consecutive duplicates removed.
def filter_less_than(lst, threshold):
Return a new list of elements < threshold.
def filter_greater_than(lst, threshold):
Return a new list of elements > threshold.
def filter_equal(lst, value):
Return a new list of elements equal to value.
def remove_value(lst, value):
Return a new list with all occurrences of value removed.
def map_add(lst, k):
Return a new list where k is added to each element.
def map_subtract(lst, k):
Return a new list where k is subtracted from each element.
def map_multiply(lst, k):
Return a new list where each element is multiplied by k.
def map_abs(lst):
Return a new list of absolute values of elements.
def map_negate(lst):
Return a new list where each element is negated.
def clamp(lst, low, high):
Return a new list where each element is clamped to [low, high].
def pow_int(lst, exp):
Return a new list where each element is raised to integer power exp.
def sum_list(lst):
Return the sum of the elements in lst.
def product_list(lst):
Return the product of the elements in lst (1 for empty).
def min_value(lst):
Return the smallest element in lst.
def max_value(lst):
Return the largest element in lst.
def argmin_index(lst):
Return the index of the first occurrence of the minimum value.
def argmax_index(lst):
Return the index of the first occurrence of the maximum value.
def is_sorted_ascending(lst):
Return True if lst is nondecreasing.
def is_sorted_strict_ascending(lst):
Return True if lst is strictly increasing.
def sort_ascending(lst):
Return a new list with elements sorted in nondecreasing order.
def sort_descending(lst):
Return a new list with elements sorted in nonincreasing order.
def stable_partition_even_odd(lst):
Return a new list with all even numbers first, preserving order.
def partition_by_value(lst, pivot):
Return a new list with elements < pivot, then == pivot, then > pivot.
def binary_search(lst, value):
Return index of value in a sorted lst, or -1 if not found.
def lower_bound(lst, value):
Return first index i where lst[i] >= value in sorted lst.
def upper_bound(lst, value):
Return first index i where lst[i] > value in sorted lst.
def rotate_left(lst, k):
Return a new list rotated left by k positions.
def rotate_right(lst, k):
Return a new list rotated right by k positions.
def shift_left_fill(lst, k, fill):
Return a new list shifted left by k, filling vacated spots with fill.
def shift_right_fill(lst, k, fill):
Return a new list shifted right by k, filling vacated spots with fill.
def take(lst, n):
Return the first n elements (or all if n exceeds length).
def drop(lst, n):
Return lst without the first n elements (or empty if n exceeds length).
def take_while_positive(lst):
Return the longest prefix of lst with positive numbers.
def drop_while_positive(lst):
Return lst with the longest positive-number prefix removed.
def prefix_sums(lst):
Return a new list of running sums.
def prefix_max(lst):
Return a new list where each element is the max up to that index.
def prefix_min(lst):
Return a new list where each element is the min up to that index.
def diff_adjacent(lst):
Return a new list of differences lst[i+1] - lst[i].
def pair_sums(lst):
Return a new list of sums of adjacent pairs.
def window_sums(lst, w):
Return a new list of sums over each window of size w.
def window_max(lst, w):
Return a new list of maximums over each window of size w.
def interleave(lst, other):
Return a new list by alternating elements from lst and other.
def zip_sum(lst, other):
Return a new list where each element is lst[i] + other[i] up to min length.
def zip_diff(lst, other):
Return a new list where each element is lst[i] - other[i] up to min length.
def union_ordered(lst, other):
Return unique elements from lst then other, preserving first appearance.
def intersection_ordered(lst, other):
Return unique elements appearing in both, in order of first appearance in lst.
def difference_ordered(lst, other):
Return elements of lst not in other, preserving order.
def symmetric_difference_ordered(lst, other):
Return elements appearing in exactly one of lst or other, in order encountered.
def repeat_each(lst, times):
Return a new list with each element repeated 'times' times.
def expand_by_counts(values, counts):
Return a new list by repeating values[i] counts[i] times.
def compress_by_mask(lst, mask):
Return a new list keeping lst[i] where mask[i] is truthy (nonzero).
def indices_where_equal(lst, value):
Return a list of indices where lst[i] == value.
def indices_where_even(lst):
Return a list of indices where elements are even.
def move_element(lst, from_index, to_index):
Return a new list with the element moved to a new position.
def swap_indices(lst, i, j):
Return a new list with elements at i and j swapped.
def distinct_count(lst):
Return the number of distinct values in lst.
def mode_value(lst):
Return the value with the highest frequency; first such in case of tie.
def mean_floor(lst):
Return the floor of the average of elements (0 if empty).
def median_for_sorted(lst):
Return the middle element for odd-length sorted lst, or lower middle for even.
def range_span(lst):
Return max(lst) - min(lst) or 0 if empty.
def normalize_min_zero(lst):
Return a new list with min value subtracted from each element.
def remove_negatives(lst):
Return a new list with negative numbers removed.
def keep_negatives(lst):
Return a new list with only negative numbers.
def signs(lst):
Return a new list mapping negatives to -1, zeros to 0, positives to 1.
def bounded_increase(lst, step):
Return a new list where each element increases by at most 'step' from previous.
def group_consecutive_equals(lst):
Return a list of group sizes of consecutive equal runs.
def expand_run_length(values, lengths):
Return a new list expanding each value by its run length.
def strip_leading_value(lst, value):
Return lst with leading value occurrences removed.
def strip_trailing_value(lst, value):
Return lst with trailing value occurrences removed.
def pad_left(lst, total_length, fill):
Return a new list padded on the left to total_length with fill.
def pad_right(lst, total_length, fill):
Return a new list padded on the right to total_length with fill.
def bounded_clip_changes(lst, limit):
Return a new list where difference between consecutive elements is limited to +/-limit.
def next_permutation(lst):
Return the next lexicographic permutation of lst or the same list if none.
def previous_permutation(lst):
Return the previous lexicographic permutation of lst or the same list if none.
def kth_smallest(lst, k):
Return the kth smallest element (0-based) assuming 0 <= k < len(lst).
def remove_outside_range(lst, low, high):
Return a new list keeping only elements in [low, high].
def stable_unique_by_first_occurrence(lst):
Return a new list removing later duplicates, keeping first occurrences only.
